result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason John Asp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason John Asp

Prior: St. Croix County Jail Inmate 1101 Carmichael Road, Hudson, WI 54016
DE appeared. DE to pay $ 50.00/mo comm 11-15-2022. $15 PPF added. DE signed PPA.

8:39 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jason John Asp. Defendant Jason John Asp in court. Court reviews case. Atty Chapman states resolution. DE pleas N/C to Amended Count 1: Ordinance 58. Court accepts plea. Court orders: $200.50. Adjourned 08:42 AM

DE called at 8:15 a.m. stating his ride fell through, but he found another one and will be 5-10 minutes late. JA advised there are other cases also scheduled at 8:30, so when he arrives, to head to courtroom 2 and take a seat until his case is called.  gll

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Travis Satorius; hereby appointing Atty Chapman. kma

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:01 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Jason John Asp. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Enters NG plea. Waives speedy trial. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned
Settlement conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
